alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Greensville; Isle of Wight; Southampton; Suffolk; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 9:27PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHAMPTON...NORTHWESTERN HERTFORD...GREENSVILLE...SOUTHWESTERN ISLE OF WIGHT...SOUTHAMPTON... SOUTH CENTRAL SUSSEX AND SOUTHEASTERN BRUNSWICK COUNTIES...THE CITY OF FRANKLIN...THE CITY OF EMPORIA AND THE SOUTHWESTERN CITY OF SUFFOLK THROUGH 1015 PM EST... At 927 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southeast of Warrenton to 6 miles south of Halifax. Movement was northeast at 80 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Roanoke Rapids and Garysburg around 940 PM EST. Gaston, Conway, and Seaboard around 945 PM EST. Boykins and Dahlia around 950 PM EST. Newsoms, Como, and Claresville around 955 PM EST. Franklin and Suffolk around 1000 PM EST. Courtland, Holland, Hunterdale, and Carrsville around 1005 PM EST. Sedley around 1010 PM EST. Other locations impacted by these storms include Milwaukee, Grizzard, Gum Forks, Pleasant Shade, Henrico, Jackson, Pleasant Grove, Lees Mill, Creeksville, and Gumberry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Brunswick; Greensville; Isle of Wight; Southampton; Suffolk; Sussex
